Enumeration Type Documentation

enum TokenType
 

Type of Token.

Each token in a Boolean expression is one of the following types:

  • A variable
  • A constant (true or false)
  • A binary operator
  • A unary operator
Enumerator:
invalid 
variable 
constant 
binary_op 
unary_op 

Definition at line 23 of file Token.h.

enum TokenValue
 

Token value.

Each type of token can take on a different sort of value. If the token is a variable, its value is the (int) version of the letter ('a' to 'z'). For operations, it's one of the items in the enumeration below. For the constants, no value is needed.

Enumerator:
NOP 
AND 
OR 
NOT 
IF_THEN 
THEN_IF
